alert.note: Alert for Knott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 2:24PM EDT until July 31 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Floyd, Knott and Pike. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen in areas that were already hit by heavy rainfall in previous days. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pikeville, Estill, Coal Run Village, Forest Hills, Wayland, Zebulon, Coal Run, Chloe, Raccoon, Meta, Boldman, Osborn, Harold, Betsy Layne, Justell, Aluba, Grethel, Galveston, Kimper and Honaker. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
